stories.headline: Deepfake Disaster Goes Viral
stories.preview: A realistic AI deepfake video of a local celebrity sparks outrage online â€” and the algorithm eats it up.
stories.fullStory:
A local influencer woke up to find themselves at the center of a storm â€” not of their own making, but thanks to AI. A realistic deepfake video, indistinguishable from reality to the casual eye, spread like wildfire across social media within hours. The clip was shared, stitched, captioned, and remixed on every platform imaginable, racking up millions of views in the process.

Consent? Ethics? These were afterthoughts. The algorithm rewarded nothing but engagement, clicks, and shares. Outrage became currency, and chaos was king. Followers debated, argued, and shared screenshots while the influencer could do little more than watch their reputation hang in the balance.

This is the double-edged sword of our digital age. Virality often comes at the expense of truth. In the algorithmâ€™s world, the story isnâ€™t about justice or fairness â€” itâ€™s about traction. The more shocking, controversial, or sensational, the more fuel it provides the machine.

As AI deepfakes get more convincing, the challenge grows. How do we navigate a landscape where appearances are unreliable, where a single video can erase years of credibility? The Deepfake Disaster serves as a warning: in the attention economy, truth is optional, but virality is mandatory.
